Investing in IPOs? Your money may be funding the promoter, not the companyAccording to a detailed study by 1 Finance Magazine, which analysed more than 1,700 IPOs between 2015 and 2025, 63% of total IPO proceeds now come from Offer for Sale. Only 37% is fresh capital raised for business growth.

Infosys down 18% in a month, TCS falls 14%: Is it an opportunity to buy IT stocks?IT stocks have corrected sharply, but is this panic justified? Before you decide to sell or buy the dip, here's what the AI shift and global slowdown really mean for investors.

Gold, silver prices drop sharply. Are they still a safe bet for investors?Gold and silver prices have dipped, but does that mean the rally is over? Experts explain what the recent correction really signals and why many investors still see strength ahead.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech: Why are major IT stocks rising today?The rebound follows a difficult few weeks for the sector. IT stocks had been under sustained pressure amid fears that rapid advances in artificial intelligence could disrupt traditional outsourcing and software services models.

Thinking of trading gold or silver futures on MCX? It just got cheaperThe MCX and the National Stock Exchange, or NSE, have removed the additional margins that were recently imposed on gold and silver futures contracts. In simple language, traders now need to block less money to take the same position as before.

IPO market buzz returns with 4 firms set to raise Rs 3,755 crore. Check detailsFour companies are set to open their public issues between February 20 and February 24, signalling a fresh round of fundraising in the mainboard segment.

India's BPCL makes first ever Venezuelan oil purchase, HMEL returns after 2 yearsBharat Petroleum buys Venezuelan oil for the first time while HPCL Mittal Energy makes its first Venezuelan purchase in two years, signaling India's crude diversification amid reduced Russian imports, sources said.

Can AI really add $550 billion to India's economy? Experts debateIndia is poised for significant AI-driven economic growth, with projections estimating a USD 550 billion boost by 2035. Industry leaders discuss the need for balanced optimism, innovation, and supportive policies to realise AI's potential in the country fully.

Can India turn its data edge into global AI leadership? Experts debateAt the India Today AI Summit, the conversation moved beyond algorithms and valuations to a more fundamental question: power. As panellists noted, artificial intelligence runs not just on data and chips but on massive, uninterrupted energy supply to fuel data centres and high-performance computing. With AI workloads rising globally, advanced economies such as the United States and parts of Europe are already grappling with grid stress and delays in expanding generation capacity. Against this backdrop, speakers argued that India's relative energy sufficiency and ongoing renewable expansion could offer a strategic edge. India has added significant power capacity in recent years and is pushing solar, wind and green hydrogen projects, positioning itself to meet rising digital infrastructure demand. If managed well, this energy readiness could help India scale domestic data centres, strengthen data sovereignty and even emerge as a competitive AI hub, turning power security into economic advantage in the global AI race.

How infrastructure and innovation are driving India's AI growthAt the India Today AI Summit 2026, industry leaders unpacked what truly powers AI, i.e., from advanced chips and data centres to voice tools and open-source platforms.

India's AI opportunity is real, says OpenAI's chief economistArtificial intelligence is not hype and it is not a bubble. That was the clear message from Dr Aaron Ronnie Chatterji, Chief Economist at OpenAI, at the India Today AI Summit 2026.

Inside India's rapid AI rise: Experts talk infrastructure and innovationExperts said that India is on the brink of a major AI expansion. If infrastructure, open technology and user-friendly applications grow together, AI could become part of everyday life for hundreds of millions.

Why Episode 5 of A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms beats GoT at its own game Episode 5 of A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, titled In the Name of the Mother, delivers its most powerful chapter yet with the tense Trial of Seven and a defining turn for Ser Duncan the Tall.

The Kerala Story 2 trailer shows state negatively, petition in High Court alleges A petition challenging the release of The Kerala Story 2 – Goes Beyond has led the Kerala High Court to issue notices to the I&B Ministry, CBFC, and the film's producer. The court will hear the case on February 24, amid concerns over the film's portrayal of Kerala and potential impact on regional harmony.

Anurag Kashyap's Kennedy: Censors tweak Trump, Dawood references; mute cuss words The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has approved Anurag Kashyap's Kennedy for release, but only after the filmmakers implemented several edits, including muting explicit language and replacing references to public figures with generic terms.
Emmy-winning series The Pitt is coming to India, TVF has the rights TVF secured rights to adapt Emmy-winning medical drama The Pitt, but how will the Indian version reshape the story?

Siddhant Chaturvedi, Mrunal Thakur recall how filmi romance skewed their love lives In an exclusive chat with India Today, Mrunal Thakur and Siddhant Chaturvedi opened up about growing up on filmy romances and how those cinematic ideals shaped, and sometimes skewed, their own love lives.

Rajeev Khandelwal recalls Bhansali's shelved Chenab Gandhi: Signed it for script Actor Rajeev Khandelwal said he signed filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's film Chenab Gandhi solely for its powerful script. The actor revealed it was the only commercial film he agreed to, but it never took off.

Dhruv Vikram's cozy selfie with Anupama Parameswaran has fans talking Dhruv Vikram and Anupama Parameswaran have once again sparked dating rumours after she reshared his selfie with a heart emoji, setting off fan speculation. The two were recently seen in the movie Bison Kaalamaadan.

Taylor Swift crowned world's best-selling artist again, after Spotify triumph Taylor Swift secures IFPI's Biggest-Selling Global Artist title for 2025, extending her remarkable winning streak, but what powered her latest triumph?

Rajpal Yadav dances to Salman Khan's song at niece's pre-wedding function. Watch Actor Rajpal Yadav was seen dancing at his niece's pre-wedding celebrations after his release from Tihar Jail. In a statement earlier, the actor said he needs "time more than sympathy" to prove the truth about his case.

Vishal Bhardwaj is proud of O'Romeo, calls it the most successful film of his life Vishal Bhardwaj remained confident that his latest film O'Romeo, despite mixed reviews and box office debates, will become his most successful project. The romantic crime drama starring Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri has sparked discussions with its bold blend of romance and violence.

Riteish Deshmukh's Raja Shivaji first look poster out. Check release date The first look poster of Riteish Deshmukh's upcoming directorial Raja Shivaji has been unveiled on the occasion of Shiv Jayanti. Check out the film's release date, complete cast and other details here.

general news.headline: UK blocks Trump from using RAF base near Swindon for potential Iran strikesUK government declined to authorise American long-range bombing operations from RAF Fairford in Gloucestershire, citing that participation in pre-emptive attacks on Iran could breach international law. Washington has stepped up its military presence in the Middle East and is drawing up contingency plans for possible strikes against Iran.

Indian truck driver arrested after 3-vehicle collision kills man in IndianaThe collision occurred shortly before noon at US 36 and County Road 525 East in Hendricks County, between Avon and Danville. According to the report, a Freightliner tractor-trailer travelling eastbound failed to stop at a red signal and struck a northbound Chevrolet pickup.

Was Lord Mountbatten involved in child sex abuse?Andrew Windsor Mountbatten, who was stripped of his prince title over his links with convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, was arrested in the UK on Thursday. Andrew is the grand-nephew of Lord Mountbatten, the last British viceroy in India. Lord Mountbatten was accused of being involved in a child sex ring, involving an orphanage in Belfast. Here's what we know about the Kincora Boys' Home scandal.

Awkward. OpenAI's Sam Altman, Anthropic's Dario Amodei skip unity hand-raiseWith PM Modi beside them at Delhi's AI Summit, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei skipped the requested unity hand-raise. The two tech rivals appeared uncomfortable, ultimately raising their fists instead, highlighting their ongoing ideological and professional rivalry despite being on the same stage at Bharat Mandapam.

Multi-crore restaurant tax scam unearthed, Rs 70,000-crore turnover concealedA nationwide investigation into the restaurant industry has revealed widespread tax evasion, with authorities analysing nearly 60 terabytes of transactional data and exposing concealed sales estimated at Rs 70,000 crore across multiple states since 2019–20.

Temperatures to rise in North India from Friday, South braces for rainNorthern India will see rising temperatures and clear skies tomorrow while parts of the south prepare for heavy rainfall. Experts suggest a warm weekend ahead for the plains.

The day an AI summit felt strangely, beautifully humanAt the summit of AI giants, the technology was impressive, but the experience was even more memorable. Messy queues outside, serene discussions inside, and an irony that made the whole day feel wonderfully, unmistakably human. Here's how I spent my day at the India AI Impact Summit...

Trump again claims he pushed India, Pak to peace: I threatened with 200% tariffsSpeaking at the initial meeting of the Board of Peace in Washington, Trump repeated that tariff threats and direct calls to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Shehbaz Sharif halted hostilities between India and Pakistan in May last year.

Yunus out, India to restore all visa services in Bangladesh soonIndia would soon be resuming all visa services in Bangladesh, a senior Indian diplomat was quoted by Bangladeshi media as saying. Amid threats to its missions, India had stopped visa services, beginning December 17 last year. What was on menu at PM's AI Summit dinner with world leadersAs the India AI Impact Summit 2026 continues at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi, the conversations extend beyond tech and policy to a gala dinner hosted by Prime Minister Narendra Modi — an evening where India served world leaders a seasonal, soulful taste of its culinary heritage.

Passport revoked, travel from UK barred: Mallya tells court he can't return to IndiaMallya, who left India in March 2016, is accused of defaulting on multiple loan repayments amounting to several thousand crores. He was declared a Fugitive Economic Offender in January 2019 by a special court hearing cases under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Following the declaration, extradition proceedings against him were initiated.

Afghanistan give Jonathan Trott a happy farewell with dominant win vs Canada T20 World Cup, AFG vs CAN: Afghanistan beat Canada by 82 runs at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai to finish their campaign on a positive note. The Afghans also gave their head coach, Jonathan Trott, a happy farewell.

T20 World Cup: Shai Hope explains the secret behind West Indies' clinical run West Indies captain Shai Hope has credited clarity of roles, calm execution, and strong collective belief for his team's dominant run into the Super Eights of the T20 World Cup.

Confident Sikandar Raza plots Super 8 twist in Zimbabwe's underdog story T20 World Cup, SL vs ZIM: Sikandar Raza said that Zimbabwe would look to carry their good form into the Super 8 after beating Sri Lanka by six wickets on Thursday in Colombo.

Zimbabwe continue dream run, stun Sri Lanka to enter Super Eight unbeaten ICC T20 World Cup: Zimbabwe stunned Sri Lanka to remain unbeaten in Group B, finishing on top of a table that also featured Australia and Ireland. Karnataka enter Ranji Trophy final, to face Jammu and Kashmir in title clashKarnataka qualified for the Ranji Trophy final for the first time in 11 years after advancing based on a first-innings lead in their drawn semifinal against Uttarakhand on Thursday.

Watch: Proud Harmanpreet pats her own back after historic T20I vs AustraliaINDW vs AUSW: Harmanpreet Kaur became the most-capped player in women's international cricket with 356 matches. She reached the landmark in the second T20I against Australia on Thursday.

Pakistan hockey chief resigns after banning captain for 2 years over Sydney fiascoThe Pakistan Hockey Federation president Tariq Bugti resigned from his role in the aftermath of the Australia tour fiasco. Bugti sent his resignation only after slapping a two-year ban on Pakistan captain Ammad Shakeel Butt, after he exposed PHF for their negligence.

After T20 World Cup 2026 debacle, Australia to conduct forensic reviewAustralia will conduct a comprehensive review following its early group-stage exit at the T20 World Cup 2026. Losses to Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe and key injuries contributed to an early elimination, prompting selectors to examine all aspects of the campaign.

West Indies make it 4 in 4, crush Italy's send-off hopes before Super 8sT20 World Cup: West Indies signed off the group stage in style, crushing Italy by 42 runs in Kolkata to make it four wins in four. Shai Hope's 75 set the tone before Shamar Joseph and Matthew Forde sealed the rout.

Give Babar a break: Pakistan must give their star batter clarity amid poor formT20 World Cup, PAK vs NAM: Babar Azam has struggled at No.4 in the tournament and didn't even get a chance to bat when Pakistan lost three wickets against Namibia in their must-win clash on Wednesday.

T20 World Cup: Hardik Pandya, Bumrah share signed jerseys with Netherlands squadHardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah won hearts after India's win over the Netherlands in Ahmedabad. The duo gifted signed jerseys to Dutch players as India completed a perfect group stage and moved into the Super 8s.

End of the road for Glenn Maxwell? Ponting predicts retirement after T20 World CupT20 World Cup: Ricky Ponting has hinted that Glenn Maxwell could be nearing retirement after Australia's early T20 World Cup exit. Ponting believes the February 20 match vs Oman may be Maxwell's final World Cup appearance.

Delhi's unfulfilled rugby promise: Stadium turns into park as players struggleThe promise of India's first dedicated rugby stadium in Delhi fails as the land in Maidan Garhi becomes a public space, leaving players struggling without basic facilities.

Is Varun Chakravarthy more lethal for India than Bumrah? Srikkanth reactsT20 World Cup: Kris Srikkanth called Varun Chakravarthy a modern-day T20I great and claimed that the spinner is more lethal for India than Jasprit Bumrah at the moment. Varun continues to spin his web around the batters in T20 World Cup 2026.

Navneet Dhaliwal: The Punjab boy who carried Canada's flag to two World CupsT20 World Cup: Retiring as Canada's highest run-scorer in T20Is, Navneet Dhaliwal, in an exclusive interview, reflects on his journey from Punjab's Under-19 grounds to leading Canada to two World Cups, while also speaking about his consistent push for greater exposure for Associate teams.

Bangladesh seeks fast reset in India cricket ties after World Cup drama, Yunus exitBangladesh's new Youth and Sports Minister, Aminul Haque, hinted that Dhaka was moving to repair strained cricket ties with India after a fallout over the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026. Haque said he held talks with India's Deputy High Commissioner and emphasised a desire to resolve differences through "friendly talks".

India's bowling troubles in T20 World Cup: Former stars flag Super 8s questions T20 World Cup: Former India cricketers Virender Sehwag and Mohit Sharma have flagged India's bowling lapses despite their unbeaten group-stage run in the T20 World Cup. With Super 8s looming, India's death-overs control remains under scrutiny.

Is Shivam Dube the first name on India's T20I playing XI? Irfan Pathan reactsIrfan Pathan heaped praise on Shivam Dube, claiming that the all-rounder has made himself the first name on India's team sheet for T20Is with improvements in his batting and bowling. Dube was star of the show for India against the Netherlands.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
